messages.title: Oxford United community boost
messages.content: Andrew has met Darryl Eales and Mark Ashton, Chairman and Chief Executive of Oxford United to discuss building up the Club's community links and activities.

messages.title: NO to Trident
messages.content: In a recent House of Commons debate, Andrew voted for a motion that Trident should not be renewed.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Andrew Smith says too many local people cannot afford anywhere affordable to live. In Oxford, the Labour City Council is: getting on with plans to build 950+ new council homes - long term secure tenancies at fair rent, protects council house tenancies at Barton Park, and also the Right to Buy Back your council home.
Abolish rip-off letting agent fees, saving tenants on average £350. Insulate five million homes, helping families save money on energy bills.
Raise labour standards on site - from health & safety to making sure local people get jobs from local building projects, including apprenticeships.
Labour will stand up for low-paid workers by increasing fines for employers paying below Living Wage. An £8 minimum wage by 2020.
Employers on company remuneration committees ensuring no one receives a pay rise unless the lowest paid do too.
25 hours of free childcare for 3 and 4 year olds to help families cope with rising costs.

mentions.candidate: Andrew Smith has met Darryl Eales and Mark Ashton. Andrew voted for a motion that Trident should not be renewed.
mentions.partyLeader: Ed Miliband has pledged if Labour forms the next government, then it's the JR 50 hours guarantee.

issues.health: Andrew stepped in quickly to support a health worker who was wrongly suspended by contractors Carillion at the JR Hospital.

housing.content: Oxford has a housing crisis. Andrew sees for himself the new council housing being built at Minchery Farm. Protecting private tenants from revenge evictions and rogue landlords.

endorsements.endorsement: Local UNISON secretary Mark Ladbrooke said: 'It's good to see an MP standing up for low paid workers.'
The worker concerned said: 'Andrew was there for me when I needed him.'

quotes.text: It's good to see an MP standing up for low paid workers.
Andrew was there for me when I needed him.

images.caption: Andrew Smith with others outside a building.
Interior of a building under construction.
